info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:37PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CUSTER COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southeast of Hayward, or 16 miles south of Rapid City. The thunderstorm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hermosa around 540 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.
